title: Default values in a tenant
content:
This page lists the default values for a tenant. 

File settings

Setting Default value

Max file size (MB)

The default maximum attachment size allowed in the tenant is 10 MB. 

Max total file size for email attachments (MB)

The maximum allowed size of attachments (1-20M) that agent users can send from a record (such as a Purchase order record) by using the Send by email option.

Max Dev2Prod package file size (MB)

The default maximum package (.pkb) file size allowed for running an import (including an import simulation) in this tenant by using the Dev2Prod functionality is 50 MB.

The maximum size of a .pkb file attached to a record is controlled by the Max file size setting; if a .pkb file contains catalog data, each attachment file of a catalog record is also controlled by the Max file size setting. 

Attachments allowlist

By default, the attachment file types allowed in the tenant are gif, jpeg, jpg, png, xls, xlsx, csv, txt, bmp, tif, tiff, log, pkb, eml, and avif.

Tuning settings

Setting Default value

BI sync storage quota (GB)

The default storage quota for BI sync data is 10 GB.

Maximum history export size (normal user)

The default maximum number of the history records that are allowed to be exported with the normal user permission is 500 lines.

Maximum history export size (admin user)

The default maximum number of the history records that are allowed to be exported with the admin user permission is 2000 lines.

Maximum query size

The default maximum number of queries is 10000.

Maximum bulk update size

The default maximum size of each bulk update is 500.

Report quota

The default maximum number of report quota points is 1095000. See Report quota management.

Maximum record size in DSL

The default maximum number of records that can be integrated through DSL is 500.

Enable daily VACUUM

The daily VACUUM for SLT data is enabled by default.

VACUUM execution time

The daily VACUUM is triggered at midnight (00:00 a.m.) by default.

Enable hourly on-demand VACUUM

The hourly on-demand VACUUM for SLT data is enabled by default.

PostgreSQL dead tuple threshold

The default PostgreSQL dead tuple threshold is 500000.

Enable internal audit log

The internal RMS audit log is written to the tenant audit table by default.

Maximum rule execution rate for current SMAX

The default maximum number of Integration Studio rules that can be processed per minute against Service Management is 1000.

Maximum rule execution rate for target system

The default maximum number of Integration Studio rules that can be processed per minute against the target system is 1000. 

Maximum request processing rate for listener

The default maximum number of requests from external systems that can be processed per minute by the listener is 200.

OData settings

Setting Default value

Enable OData service

By default, the OData service can access your Service Management data source.

Maximum number of concurrent requests

The default maximum number of concurrent REST calls from OData is 50.

Maximum number of records per day

The default maximum number of records that can be returned by OData REST calls per day is 100000000.

Maximum page size

The default maximum number of records returned in a single page from OData using server-side pagination is 5000.

Delay time

The default delay time between subsequent page requests is 0 seconds1.

1. You can adjust this delay as per your requirements and available capacity.

Group members sync settings

Setting Default value

Pull group members from IdM

Pulls group members from IdM is enabled by default.

Pulling interval (hours)

The default interval at which Service Management pulls group members from IdM is 12 hours.

Password policy (for DB users)

Setting Default value

Lockout threshold

5

An account is locked after 5 invalid password attempts.

Lockout duration

15 minutes

Idle day

90 days

Max unlock threshold

2

Minimum password length

10

Maximum password length

16

Password expiration duration

90 days

Password check

  • The password must contain both upper and lower case letters.

  • The password must contain at least one numeric character.

  • The password must contain a special character. For the special characters, it refers to all characters except alphabet characters, numbers, and “-“.

  • A new password can't match any of the last 10 passwords.

  • The user's attribute values aren't allowed to be used as a password.

User session timeout

Setting Default value

Access token expiration period 

60 minutes

The access token is renewed when 35% defined expiration period has passed. Due to the less frequent renewal mechanism, the actual session timeout is shorter than what is expected. In extreme cases, users may experience a session timeout right after half of the desired time.

For example, Carol logs in to the system at 2:00. Carol operates on the UI till 2:20 and goes away. When Carol comes back to the system at 3:01, Carol will find the session times out. To Carol, it seems the system kicks out the session which is only idle for 40 minutes instead of 60 minutes. What happens is when Carol logs in to the system, a token is produced. In each request to backend services, it checks how long the token is to expire. Since the token won't expire in 21 minutes, it's not renewed. From 2:21 to 3:00, since there are no requests from the client, there's no chance to renew the token. At 3:01, when a request comes from the client, the token exceeds its expiration period so that the session is timed out.
